SEARCH
Package domain

Class Game

java.lang.Object
domain.Game
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Flow.Subscriber<Integer>
Direct Known Subclasses:
LimitedGame, NormalGame, QuickTimeGame
public abstract class Game extends Object implements Flow.Subscriber<Integer>, Serializable
The abstract Game class defines the common structure and behavior for Gomoku games. Subclasses must extend this class and implement the abstract methods to create specific games.
Version:
1.8.5
Author:
Juan Daniel Murcia - Mateo Forero Fuentes
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game(int size)
      Constructs a Game object with the specified size and percentage of special elements.
      Parameters:
      size - The size of the game board, indicating the dimensions.
      especialPercentage - The percentage of special elements in the game.

  • Method Details

    • getGameSubtypes

      public static Set<Class<? extends Game>> getGameSubtypes()
      Retrieves a set of all classes that extends the Game class within the "domain" package.
      Returns:
      A set of Class objects representing the game subtypes.

    • setPlayers

      public void setPlayers(String typePlayer1, String typePlayer2) throws ClassNotFoundException, InstantiationException, IllegalAccessException, IllegalArgumentException, InvocationTargetException, NoSuchMethodException, SecurityException
      Sets the players for the game based on the specified player types.
      Parameters:
      typePlayer1 - The type of player 1, represented as a String.
      typePlayer2 - The type of player 2, represented as a String.
      Throws:
      ClassNotFoundException - If the specified player type classes are not found.
      InstantiationException - If an instance of the player type cannot be created (abstract class or interface).
      IllegalAccessException - If the player type's constructor is not accessible due to access modifiers.
      IllegalArgumentException - If the provided arguments are not valid for the player type's constructor.
      InvocationTargetException - If an exception occurs while invoking the player type's constructor.
      NoSuchMethodException - If a matching method is not found in the specified player type class.
      SecurityException - If a security violation occurs during reflection.

    • setPlayersInfo

      public void setPlayersInfo(String nameOne, Color color1, String nameTwo, Color color2)
      Sets the information for players in the game, including names and colors.
      Parameters:
      nameOne - The name of player one.
      color1 - The color associated with player one.
      nameTwo - The name of player two.
      color2 - The color associated with player two.

    • setNumTokens

      public void setNumTokens(int numTokens)
      Sets the number of tokens that will have the players
      Parameters:
      numTokens - The number of tokens for the game

    • setTimeLimit

      public void setTimeLimit(int timeLimit)
      Sets the limit time that will have the players
      Parameters:
      timeLimit - the limit in seconds of the players -1 for inifinite time

    • setEspecialInfo

      public void setEspecialInfo(int especialPercentageTokens, int especialPercentageSquares)
      Sets the special information for the game, including the percentage of special tokens and squares. It initializes the special squares on the board, sets the percentage of special tokens, and starts the game.
      Parameters:
      especialPercentageTokens - The percentage of special tokens to be used in the game.
      especialPercentageSquares - The percentage of special squares on the board.

    • play

      public int[] play()
      Initiates a move in the game by instructing the current player (based on the turn count) to play. If the current player is an AI player, the returned ArrayList contains a string representing the type of token, and two integers indicating the row and column where the AI player chose to play. If the current player is a human player, the method returns null, indicating that no precalculated move is available.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList containing AI player move information or null for human players.

    • play

      public void play(int row, int column) throws GomokuException
      Plays a move in the game by placing a token at the specified row and column for the current player. The player's turn alternates between Player One and Player Two.
      Parameters:
      row - The row where the player wants to place the token.
      column - The column where the player wants to place the token.
      token - The player's token to be placed on the game board.
      Throws:
      GomokuException

    • playToken

      public void playToken(Token token, int row, int column) throws GomokuException
      Plays the specified token at the given row and column on the game board.
      Parameters:
      token - The token to be placed on the game board.
      row - The row where the token will be placed.
      column - The column where the token will be placed.
      Throws:
      GomokuException

    • getPlayerTokens
